eventName: Adventure That Cannot Wait for the Sun
storyInfo: In the museum of Menat-Ha'mait, Acting Curator Anat and Vice Curator Medjehtiqedti await an honored guest: Pepe, daughter of the Padishah. Pepe has come with the intent to borrow the museum's crown jewel: the Nameless General. But she is unaware that the desert bandit Narantuya has also arrived in the city following her.

attributes.content: Raise that lamp a little higher, I need the light on every detail of the exhibits.
attributes.name: Frantic Girl

attributes.content: Yes, Curator Hanimefendi!
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Who put this statue of a songstress with the sculptures from the Old Calendar Age of Shadows? Completely wrong era. Take it out and move it to Hall Two.
attributes.name: Frantic Girl

attributes.content: I'm on it, Curator Hanimefendi!
attributes.name: Museum Staff

attributes.content: Where is that instrument restored with tech from the Old Calendar Age of Chants? Why don't I see it?
attributes.name: Frantic Girl

attributes.content: Not here...
attributes.name: Frantic Girl

attributes.content: Not here either...
attributes.name: Frantic Girl

attributes.content: ♪O guests from afar, ripples in the lotus pond follow thee here♪
attributes.name: Cheery Singing

attributes.content: ♪Neath the tree's shade, sup sweet dates and fresh beer♪
attributes.name: Cheery Singing

attributes.content: ♪Let us toast now to a midsummer, and cheers!♪
attributes.name: Cheery Singing

attributes.content: Oh, Medjehtiqedti Hanimefendi, your singing rivals even the most elegant of fowlbeasts! I can't tear myself away!
attributes.name: Sycophantic Employee

attributes.content: Ah, Medjehtiqedti Hanimefendi, the notes of your lute flow like purest water! Like the calmest, sweetest brook!
attributes.name: Ingratiating Employee

attributes.content: But of course. I have worked tirelessly for months to produce the perfect rendition of this ancient ballad.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Hmph. Words sweet as honey, fingers idle as a slumberfoot. No wonder I couldn't find you.
attributes.name: Frantic Girl

attributes.content: You do know that restored lute is going on display tomorrow, right, Titi?
attributes.name: Frantic Girl

attributes.content: Do allow the welcoming committee to borrow it for today, Anat. We have an honored guest coming, and the museum must receive her well.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: It's a special exhibit for the Flood Festival, Titi.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Our top priority is ensuring there are no errors in any of the sections.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Our visitors can be very fussy about the details. You've been here long enough, you should know better than I.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Let's not get mad now, Curator Hanimefendi.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: This is your first major exhibit since taking up your post, so I understand that you're a little anxious about it.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: But trust me, Anat, you need to calm down. No matter what you're putting on display, someone is going to nitpick it.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: This is Menat-Ha'mait. Every family's got some treasure stashed away somewhere. It's no surprise they'd turn their noses up at our exhibits.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I'm going to check over the new displays for tomorrow.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: Don't worry, I won't disturb your date with that esteemed gentleman.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: It's an object I'm studying, not my date.
attributes.name: Anat

attributes.content: You look at it ever so lovingly, though.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Strange...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Has no-one picked her up yet since we've been talking?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I'm guessing that girl over there is learning how the irrigation channels work, gonna write a thesis on the history of it.
attributes.name: Extremely Idle Citizen

attributes.content: Or maybe she's an epigraphist, and she's just cleaning the sludge off the stele in the river.
attributes.name: Incredibly Bored Citizen

attributes.content: What's the difference? They're just different types of history nerd.
attributes.name: Extremely Idle Citizen

attributes.content: Blame it on the city's long history. Every historian in Sargon gets obsessed with this place.
attributes.name: Extremely Idle Citizen

attributes.content: Yeah. Look at this ancient riverway we've got here, four centuries old, broad and wide. And our buildings? A youthful two centuries, yet tall and impressive.
attributes.name: Incredibly Bored Citizen

attributes.content: You wanna talk about 'rich historical tradition'? Well, here you have it.
attributes.name: Incredibly Bored Citizen

attributes.content: Can any of them beat the Flood Festival, though? We've been celebrating it for over a thousand years.
attributes.name: Extremely Idle Citizen

attributes.content: Oh, when it floods, I'm going to offer up some white oasis flowers to the river god. May His breath be forever filled with their fragrant aroma.
attributes.name: Incredibly Bored Citizen

attributes.content: What offering have you prepared, friend?
attributes.name: Incredibly Bored Citizen

attributes.content: A cup and plate of pure gold, along with a jar of wine, in accordance with my family traditions. The wine was sealed by my grandfather when my father was born, an excellent vintage.
attributes.name: Extremely Idle Citizen

attributes.content: May He enjoy its taste, and share in the festival spirit with us.
attributes.name: Extremely Idle Citizen

attributes.content: May we meet Him wandering the realm, and earn His blessing.
attributes.name: Incredibly Bored Citizen

attributes.content: O immortal Menat-Ha'mait, may He forever grace this city.
attributes.name: Incredibly Bored Citizen

attributes.content: Did you find it yet, hanimefendi?
attributes.name: Girl by the Shore

attributes.content: Give me a sec, kiddo, I think I felt it just now.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: But you've been standing in the river for half an hour already. You keep saying you almost got it...
attributes.name: Girl by the Shore

attributes.content: Shh! I'm trying to concentrate here...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Seriously, where has our little shahzada run off to now?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I've got people at every gate waiting, but none of them have seen her.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I've put so much thought into welcoming you, how could I let you just slip into the city like this?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Masaa al-kheir, Medjehtiqedti Hanimefendi. Wherever are you going in such a hurry?
attributes.name: Happy Lady

attributes.content: Ah, Bekti Hanimefendi, it's you. I'm meeting an old friend of mine!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Here, some oranges I just plucked from my garden. They ripened just before the festival, I'm sure everyone will love them.
attributes.name: Happy Lady

attributes.content: Take a few for your friend, Medjehtiqedti Hanimefendi.
attributes.name: Happy Lady

attributes.content: She's not a fan of favors, but I thank you in her stead. Salaam, Bekti Hanimefendi.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Ma'a s-salaama!
attributes.name: Happy Lady

attributes.content: The people here are so friendly.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: *sigh* Let me have a think about where she'd go...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Where did she like to run off back when we were in school?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Ah, I'm really sorry, hanim! I didn't see you there. Forgive me for knocking your oranges on the ground.
attributes.name: Foreign Traveler

attributes.content: I'm fine, how about you? Are you alright?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti
Foreign Traveler
attributes.content: Thank you for your kindness, hanim.

attributes.name: Foreign Traveler
attributes.content: Oh no...
What's with the frown all of a sudden? Are you hurt?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: A shadow flitted across your forehead just now, an ill omen. I fear you will meet with some misfortune soon.
attributes.name: Foreign Traveler

attributes.content: If you are willing to part with five dinars, I can ward it off for you.
attributes.name: Foreign Traveler

attributes.content: Umm... Well, uh, sorry, but I've got an appointment, gotta go now! Bye!
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Wait! Two dinars! Just two dinars, then!
attributes.name: Foreign Traveler

attributes.content: This isn't a trick! You really are about to run into some bad luck!
attributes.name: Foreign Traveler

attributes.content: You wouldn't trick me, would you...?
attributes.name: Girl by the Shore

attributes.content: Of course not. I always keep my word.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Really? *sniff* But...
attributes.name: Girl by the Shore

attributes.content: Aw, don't cry, I'll—
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Agh! It slipped away again!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Waaaaaahhh!
attributes.name: Sad Girl

attributes.content: Ah, no, don't cry! I was just teasing you! I got it! See? It's right here in my hand!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You're a meanie...
attributes.name: Sad Girl

attributes.content: *sigh* I'm too used to teasing my little brother back home.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I feel sorry for your poor little brother...
attributes.name: Sad Girl

attributes.content: Save your pity, that kid gives me endless headaches. Alright, pass me the jar. I'll put the fin in it for you.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I thought I'd never see my goldfin again... Thanks, hanimefendi.
attributes.name: Sobbing Girl

attributes.content: Tsk, tsk, tsk. I worked my butt off helping you get your finny friend back. Put a little more pep into that 'thanks'.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: THANK YOU SO MUCH! YOU'RE THE BEST!
attributes.name: Sobbing Girl

attributes.content: Now that's more like it.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Alright, you'd best hurry home already. No more fancy ideas about trying to take your pet for a walk.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: See you, hanimefendi.
attributes.name: Happy Girl

attributes.content: Taking a pet fin for a walk in the river? Reminds me of the crazy ideas I had as a kid.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: *cough*
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Well then. Seems our audience has finally had enough of me groping around in the water for finbeasts.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Glad you still know me so well, Pepe.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: *sigh* I really don't want to head to the museum so soon. When Anat's in question-asking mode, I won't even get a moment's rest.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Where is she, anyway? She didn't come with you?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: She's acting curator now. Got a lot of things to do. With the upcoming super-important exhibition, she's been busier than ever.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Nice. Never thought she'd get promoted right after she arrived. I remember back in school, nobody thought she'd go far with that meek personality, but I knew she was a hard worker. She'll go far.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: She's always been one tough reed. She never yields.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Sure you aren't talking about yourself? You've been in this city for a while. No big changes?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Me? I'm not too busy, but I'm also not too free. I was just barely able to secure the title of vice curator.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Weren't you in charge of stuff at that Columbian museum?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I was in charge of their business operations. Things are different here, you know.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: The Menat-Ha'mait museum doesn't need to profit. Annual support from the Lords Ameer and the Padishahs is enough. No use for me.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Which is great. I get to take it easy.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: But you always kept yourself busy... back in the day.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: How about you? You must have gotten a lot of good stuff out of your travels.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: More than you can imagine.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Hmm. Sounds like your report's going to be a lot longer than you can imagine as well.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Oh no. It's so hot here. Feel like I've got sunstroke. I'm gonna stay here and cool down in the breeze.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Save it. Do you know how many times I used that excuse to help you ditch class?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: You've been sitting there quite a while, hanim, and the sun is rather fierce. Would you like something to drink? We have our specialty liquorice juice, freshly made. Only five dinars.
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Or how about an apple and roselle tea? Two dinars a cup.
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: Perhaps a glass of apricot juice then? Only one dinar.
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: I said no.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: Very well then...
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Hold on, waiter, not so fast. A pot of your best coffee, if you will, and add some local cardamom and cloves.
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler

attributes.content: And a glass of liquorice juice for the lady.
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler

attributes.content: Right away.
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Coming to Menat-Ha'mait for the Flood Festival, anyone should have filled their wallet. You won't get much out of your trip like this.
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler

attributes.content: No offense, but I have always been of the belief that man should live within his means. If your funds are insufficient, there are plenty more other places to enjoy a holiday.
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler

attributes.content: I've heard that Dossoles in Bolívar is rather pleasant. Cheap, with beautiful scenery, suitable for those of more... frugal means.
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler

attributes.content: You speak wisdom. A truly educated man you must be.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: You flatter me. And yourself? Broadening your horizons on the road?
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler

attributes.content: On the road...? I suppose so. I seek my own road to follow.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: Your coffee, effendi.
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Here, please.
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler

attributes.content: Your liquorice juice, hanim.
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: (Drinks it up in a single gulp)
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: I thank you for your hospitality.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: (Quietly) Hmph.
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler
Extravagant Traveler
attributes.content: Waiter, could you tell me of some particularly fun activities during your Flood Festival—

attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler
attributes.content: Why the look?
Forgive me, effendi. I am simply amazed that the hanim was so hesitant to part with her money for a drink, yet gave me a sizable tip...
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Ah, it appears my fellow traveler was of small means but great pride.
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler

attributes.content: No matter, I shall find some amusements by myself. The bill please, waiter.
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler

attributes.content: Fifteen dinars in total, effendi.
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Effendi?
attributes.name: Waiter

attributes.content: Err... Wherever has my coin-purse gone?
attributes.name: Extravagant Traveler

attributes.content: May the river wash away these gilded scraps of metal. May those who need them find them as its waters rise.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: Enough time wasted. I nearly lost sight of my target.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: I've heard the City of Radiance is adorned in jewels, and that countless brave souls have sought out its treasures without success.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: And so I walked the long road and arrived here, only to find miser after miser bickering over a few gold coins.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: A dark cloud floats by, blocking the glaring rays of the sun. The red-maned woman pours coins out of her purse, tossing them into the river with an even hand. The ripples tear apart the sun's reflection.
Then she disappears into the crowd, whistling.
Ahh... The Grand Bazaar's apricot juice still hits the spot. Tastes pretty much the same as it did back when we were in school!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: This is where I thought you'd be, but it took me some long, fruitless searching to remember that we would only ever come here the three of us.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: When you were alone, you would always go to...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: The river. I love strolling along the river by myself. Didn't think you'd run all over the place to find me.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You are an honored guest, Pepe.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: We're friends, you don't need to be so particular about all this...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You didn't organize some toe-curlingly cringey performance to welcome me back, did you?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: That would be the proper rites and ceremonies.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Save it! I can hear the cogs in your brain grinding away as you cook up your evil machinations.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: So what big discovery got you coming back here?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: A jewel.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: A jewel?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Sapphire bracelets, necklaces and earrings, make a set of your choosing, only two thousand dinars a set! If you like it then buy it, no haggling, no bargaining. Only two thousand dinars and they're yours!
attributes.name: Gem Merchant

attributes.content: Dear customers, we are now offering a lovely selection of hand-selected emerald rings. Enjoy a discount if you buy an entire box!
attributes.name: Streetside Loudspeaker

attributes.content: Guaranteed quality and weight, while still economical. Every one fifteen carats! Buy some to send home to your family and friends, only four thousand five hundred dinars for the box!
attributes.name: Streetside Loudspeaker

attributes.content: Rubies, sapphires, chrysoberyl, amethysts, rose quartz, olivine! For gems, come to the Grand Bazaar, where we offer bulk trade and low prices, all day every day!
attributes.name: TV Advertisement

attributes.content: Menat-Ha'mait's drowning in all sorts of jewels. I don't think you're turning heads if it's any regular old gem.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Hey, this jewel's pretty extraordinary, okay?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Extraordinary?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I recently bought a piece of pink kyanite. They say it was once used for purifying water. The Originium circuit carved into it is incredibly delicate, a work of art in its own right.
attributes.name: Lady of Refined Taste

attributes.content: Sounds rather valuable. I bought a similar tourmaline just last month. The power of my Arts improved substantially after laying it into my cane.
attributes.name: Ornately-Dressed Man

attributes.content: Both cannot compare with this treasure of mine. Look.
attributes.name: Impressively Stylish Elder

attributes.content: Isn't this a limited edition gemstone belt from last year? I remember the peddler said it could rejuvenate your skin and slow your aging.
attributes.name: Lady of Refined Taste

attributes.content: Do you feel anything wearing it?
attributes.name: Ornately-Dressed Man

attributes.content: I do feel rather more refreshed...
attributes.name: Impressively Stylish Elder

attributes.content: Eh, compared to the ones going around the Grand Bazaar, the one I found can do something really special.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Special how? These Originium-etched jewels being sold here are already pretty special for anyone coming from outside the city.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Let's get walking first, Titi.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Don't tell me there's some kind of dirty secret behind it?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: No way! Relax, I'll tell you, but—
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Before this scorcher of a sun gets too high in the sky, I want to run by Septagram Avenue to buy an idol. Even research needs the blessing of the gods, right?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You best walk quick then. That road's going to be too hot for your feet real soon.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: The target is moving toward the museum in the heart of the city...
attributes.name: Shady Woman

attributes.content: Considering she was personally welcomed by the vice-curator, it appears my information was correct. She is no ordinary woman.
attributes.name: Shady Woman

attributes.content: What?! The jewel you found was a relic of the Shah?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Man... I shouldn't have worn open-toed sandals. I'm going to have sandal-patterned feet later.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Seriously? You're thinking about your sandals now? Where did you find that jewel?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I got a clue in a place once known as Szubat-Arsalan. After a few twists and turns, I finally found it in the territory of a Lord Ameer.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: The Lionpride's Ancient Throne...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I also saw some ancient images left by the Shah himself in a cave full of crystals.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: And I wrote everything down in this journal. It'll make public the true location of the great trove, and prove that the Shah's promise to the Nightzmora was more than just a legend.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Just think what might be waiting for us among all those riches?
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Yet no matter how valuable that stuff may be, the true treasure is the clues that will help us reconstruct the truth of that era.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: We'll find the answers to the Shah's unsolved mysteries one by one, Titi!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Why would he make such a crazy declaration of war? Or what really happened in the legendary clash with Kharanduu Khagan in the south! Or his final resting place!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: These discoveries will shock the people! All Shar-Agade, the entire City of Gold, will be looking my way!
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: If you know where it is, just take a team there to excavate it. It's just—
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: No, there's one last trail to follow. I need to borrow an artifact from the museum.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You're the daughter of a Padishah. The museum storehouses are open to you, anything you want that isn't on public display.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Thaaaaat's the issue.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Wait. Don't tell me you want...
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Pepe looks at the facade of the museum, a banner slowly unfolding across it.
The banner depicts a slender mummy draped in golden armor, its face hidden by a death mask.
And at the end of that banner is written in great, big script:
Landmark Exhibit Commemorating Varjavandabad Museum's Anniversary—The Nameless General of the Shah's Very Court!
The General? No, he is the guardian of the trove.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: No matter who it actually is, it's Anat's most prized exhibit. I don't think you're going to borrow it that easily.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Well, a jewel with clues won't prove anything by itself. I can only show my worth to my father and the Shahanshah by finding the Shah's trove.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: If I do that, I can go to the City of Gold, become the Shahanshah's Historian of Shar-Agade, and write an account of all Sargonian history.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Being a Padishah's heir not good enough for you, Pepe?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: The wealth and authority is just superficial prosperity. The true honor that runs through our family is the role of court historian, passed down from generation to generation.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: But... Hasn't your father always wanted your brother to be the court historian?
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Well, we both have the same basic qualities. But I'm not losing to him on ability either.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Pepe, the City of Gold's envoy is taking your brother there in two months.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I'll make it in time, Titi! I just need you to help me! Anat's only willing to lend me that mummy to study come autumn.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: But this summer is my last opportunity. I can't wait that long.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: You and your brother... You were always fighting as kids, and now you're at loggerheads over the same court appointment.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: ...Here. My pass. Take it.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: You can sneak into the exhibition hall at night and study it, quietly.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Titi...
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: I'm just sick of seeing you two bicker and quarrel these past few years.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: This is the last time I'll help you. If in the end, you come up empty-handed, then please don't keep stubbornly trudging on.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: I won't. I won't come up empty-handed.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Ignoring Pepe's murmuring, Medjehtiqedti stands up to look at the grand edifice, witness to centuries of history.
The sun shines upon all the gardens and buildings, and under the boundless blue sky, the great trapezoid looms over them.
The leaves of tall palm trees besides them rustle in the wind.
I might see it every day, but I'm still stunned by its grandeur.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: For so long has it quietly guarded the city, fending off time itself in silence.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Yep. A human lifespan is nothing compared to it, no matter how long it may be.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: Over in the blink of an eye.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: If only we could stop time for a moment.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: Yeah. That would be great.
attributes.name: Pepe

attributes.content: See you at the exhibition tomorrow. If you get caught, just say you stole the pass.
attributes.name: Medjehtiqedti

attributes.content: The exhibition... tomorrow...
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: Good. The guest's itinerary has been confirmed. I'll welcome her properly.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: A descendant of a glorious clan of historians, the one who spreads ballads of kings and heroes, explorer of all Sargon, purveyor of knowledge, a respected Padishah's daughter—
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: Djerwnapekhaper Saciut Hatshepsut.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: Any other would worry they would forget all these appellations, but the one who stands here is Narantuya, and her only regret is that these titles are all held by one person.
attributes.name: Odd Woman

attributes.content: Fine. I guess the ransom ought to settle my debts even if it's just one girl.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The money left in this purse should be enough to buy a ticket for tomorrow...
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Never mind.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: The line would be too long, and the sun too hot.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: And in this city, gold coins are too common to be worth anything.
attributes.name: Narantuya

attributes.content: Do you swear by your golden sun, your splendid gems and the great museum behind you?
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: That you will answer prudently on account of your respect for history and civilization alike?
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: Look within, at your own conscience, and tell me once more. How much is a ticket to the museum?
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: I already told you, hanim. The hall for non-Sargonian artifacts is free of charge. Only the Sargonian exhibition hall needs tickets.
attributes.name: Museum Ticketer

attributes.content: If you don't understand, we have the prices for our tour services here on the window. You can hire one of our translators too, if needed.
attributes.name: Museum Ticketer

attributes.content: So the Minoan exhibition hall is free to enter?!
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: I'll say it once more, hanim. There is no 'Minoan exhibition hall'.
attributes.name: Museum Ticketer

attributes.content: But at times there will be a few Minoan artifacts on display in the Northeastern Tributary exhibit.
attributes.name: Museum Ticketer

attributes.content: ...'Northeastern Tributary'?
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: The foreign traveler takes a deep breath, the muscles of her bare arm bulging as she clenches her fist.
A part of the ticketer's mind is telling her to pull the booth's shutter closed, but the traveler's other hand is firmly holding it open.

History is a grand river beside which all who live upon this great land trek. The Originium workshops of the Ancient Town of Tal'sas were unearthed by Gaulish explorers. The scrolls detailing the legends of old Agamem were restored by Minoan artisans.
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: But Minos's own history has gone against the current, and has found itself scattered across the golden sands. I have traced its path just to catch a glimpse of its fragments.
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: Whether or not you agree, a historian's mission is to find the past that people have forgotten.
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: For the sake of this duty, should we not prevent arrogant discrimination by history's tyrannical plunderers?
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: In other words, if you believe that Sargonian history is worth a hundred dinars to see, then should Minoan history not stand equal?
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: Do you want a ticket or not, hanim?
attributes.name: Museum Ticketer

attributes.content: —Even more importantly, Sargonians, as it so happens, are the plunderers, in this case.
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: With all that said, are you willing to hold fast to your conscience and confront the true value of Minos's artifacts?
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: Next!
attributes.name: Museum Ticketer

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: My name is Aspasia ho Herias. Please, use the Minoan spelling, not a Sargonian transliteration.
attributes.name: Minoan Traveler

attributes.content: A ticket, if you would so please.
attributes.name: Aspasia
